title: Greatest Common Factor
text: The greatest common factor amongst the three terms in the expression is 1. So we need to use other approaches.

title: Perfect square
text: Is the first term of the expression a perfect square? How do you rewrite $$4x^2$$ into perfect square?

title: Perfect square
text: Is the last term of the expression a perfect square? How do you rewrite $$25y^2$$ into perfect square?

title: Formula
text: We can rewrite the expression $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2={\left(2x\right)}^2+20x y+{\left(5y\right)}^2$$. Does it fit the pattern $$a^2+2a b+b^2$$?

title: Finding x
text: If $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2={\left(2x\right)}^2+20x y+{\left(5y\right)}^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2+2a b+b^2$$, then what is a?

title: Finding y
text: If $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2={\left(2x\right)}^2+20x y+{\left(5y\right)}^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2+2a b+b^2$$, then what is b?

title: Finding 2xy
text: If $$a=2x$$ and $$b=5y$$, then what is $$2a b$$?

title: Find the pattern
text: If we have $$a=2x$$, $$b=5y$$, and $$2a b=20x y$$, then $$a^2+2a b+b^2=4x^2+20x y+25y^2$$

title: Factor first term
text: Given that $$a^2+2a b+b^2=2\left(a+b\right)$$, how do we factor $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2$$?

subHints.title: Rewrite
subHints.text: Based on the above steps, we observe that if $$a=2x$$ and $$b=5y$$, then $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2+2a b+b^2$$. Given that $$a^2+2a b+b^2=2\left(a+b\right)$$, how do we rewrite $$4x^2+20x y+25y^2$$ as a perfect square?
